alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Howard; Merrick; Nance; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 5:46PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Greeley, western Nance, eastern Valley, northwestern Merrick, eastern Sherman and Howard Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 546 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Elyria to 9 miles north of Sherman Reservoir Dam to near Hazard. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and some isolated penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Elyria and Fort Hartsuff State Park around 555 PM CDT. Ord and North Loup around 600 PM CDT. Scotia, Rockville and Cotesfield around 605 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Ashton, Greeley, Dannebrog, Farwell, Wolbach, Elba, St. Paul and Cushing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Greeley; Howard; Merrick; Nance; Sherman; Valley
